Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Already \Al*read"y\, adv. [All (OE. al) + ready.] Prior to some specified time, either past, present, or future; by this time; previously. ``Joseph was in Egypt already.'' --Exod. i. 5. [1913 Webster]
I say unto you, that Elias is come already. --Matt. xvii. 12. [1913 Webster]
Note: It has reference to past time, but may be used for a future past; as, when you shall arrive, the business will be already completed, or will have been already completed. [1913 Webster]
already adv : prior to a specified or implied time; "she has already graduated" [ant: {not yet}]
